instructions: Tap the Insert button , then tap the Tables button . Swipe right and left to see more style options. Tap a table to add it to the slide. To add content to a cell, double-tap the cell, then type; when you re finished, tap Done, or tap outside the table to dismiss the keyboard. Do any of the following: Move the table: Tap the table, then drag the Table Mover handle in its top-left corner. Add or remove rows: Tap the table, tap the Add Row button in its bottom-left corner, then tap the arrows. Resize the table: Tap the table, tap the Table Mover handle in its top-left corner, then drag the blue dot in the bottom-right corner to resize the table proportionally. Change the alternating row color setting: Tap the table, tap the Format button , tap Table, then turn Alternating Rows on or off. Change the look of a table: Tap the table, tap the Format button , then use the formatting controls to make changes.

Select the cells with the data you want to use to create the new table. Touch and hold the selection until it appears to lift, then drag it to a new position on the slide. To delete the empty cells from the original table, select the empty cells, then tap Delete.
Tap the table, then tap the Table Mover handle in its top-left corner. Tap Copy. Tap once to deselect the table, tap the edge of the screen near where you want the table to appear, then tap Paste.
